I'm a big fan of the Chicago Cubs. Do you have any interesting stats or facts about them?

Sure, here are a few interesting stats and facts about the Chicago Cubs:

1. The Cubs were founded in 1876, making them one of the oldest teams in professional baseball.
2. The Cubs' home stadium, Wrigley Field, was built in 1914 and is one of the oldest ballparks still in use today.
3. The Cubs have won three World Series titles in their history, with the most recent coming in 2016 after a 108-year drought.
4. The Cubs have retired the numbers of six players in their history: Ernie Banks (#14), Ryne Sandberg (#23), Ron Santo (#10), Billy Williams (#26), Fergie Jenkins (#31), and Greg Maddux (#31).
5. The Cubs have played in several memorable games throughout their history, including the 1908 World Series when they defeated the Detroit Tigers, and the 2016 World Series when they defeated the Cleveland Indians in extra innings in Game 7.
6. The Cubs are known for their loyal fan base, with fans often referred to as the "Cubs Nation."
7. The Cubs' mascot is a friendly bear named Clark, who was introduced in 2014.
8. Throughout their history, the Cubs have had several notable players, including Sammy Sosa, Mark Grace, Andre Dawson, and Kerry Wood.
